result.execSummary:
All charges against Joshua Shane Larson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Shane Larson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Shane Larson

defendant.name: Larson, Joshua Shane
defendant.address: 72 William Avenue, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt:
10:23 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Joshua Shane Larson.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

21CF103 & 22CF33

Atty Zaleski is heard.  
Defendant deceased.  4/10/2022. 

State moves to dismiss the pending actions in both cases. 
Atty Zaleski is heard. 
Court orders the two cases dismissed. 

Bonds to be returned to the person who posted the bond.
Notification from Sheriff's Dept.- Def. deceased on 04/10/22.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.  Defendant shall have no contact with H.M.K.

10:47 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Joshua Shane Larson appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Steven W. Zaleski for Joshua Shane Larson appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 

Court reviews preliminary questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Atty Zaleski is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 

Atty Zaleski is heard on bond modification. Requests a signature bond or reducing the cash bond. 
Atty Steiner is heard on bond modification. Requests that bond not be modified. 
Court orders a $500.00 cash bond.
Jury status hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on April 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:51 AM Defendant Joshua Shane Larson appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Steven W. Zaleski for Joshua Shane Larson appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 

Atty Zaleski is heard on status.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:33 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Joshua Shane Larson appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

Defendant is heard on status of retaining an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:07 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Joshua S Larson appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

DA is heard on bond; in case 21CF103 bond remains unchanged.
In this case 22GF38 a $1000.00 cash bond, Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Non monetary conditions - def is not to have contact with H.M.K.

Court will cancel the bench warrant in the previous case 21CF103

Court orders a $1000.00 cash bond, Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Non monetary conditions - def is not to have contact with H.M.K.

Court advises right to an atty.
Hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.  Defendant shall have no contact with H.M.K.
